metadata.title: CVE-2014-8502 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the pe_print_edata function in bfd/peXXigen.cin GNU binutils 2.24 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (crash) and possibly have other unspecified impact via atruncated export table in a PE file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8502` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
binutils-multiarch - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
binutils-source - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
binutils-static - 2.24-5ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24-5ubuntu3.1').
